About me

I'm a Rochester, NY based designer who loves to use design to make people's work lives easier and more fulfilling.

I've always found my interests at the intersection of technology and art, long before I became an Industrial Designer â€” even as a kid, I filled notebooks with drawings of the future. As digital experiences emerged, I found my human-centered design skills seamlessly translated into the UX realm. I find deep satisfaction in observing and deeply understanding people's needs, then applying an iterative process to create innovative solutions that remove frustrations and enrich people's working lives.

My passion for creating doesn't stop at work, however. I find fulfillment in hands-on making through carpentry, 3D printing, CNC milling, and other outlets for bringing ideas into physical reality. Personal projects allow me to hone my skills in an explorative, low-stakes environment.

Innovation

Innovation unlocks new possibilities. I explore ways to leverage tech solutions to eliminate unnecessary work or transform existing processes.

Research

I use interviews, testing, and observation to truly understand people and their problems to provide a delightful, natural experience.

Simplicity

Simplicity, without innovation to enable it, may make a design look nice but perform poorly. I focus on innovation to enable simplicity.

Design

Good design creates intuitive and appealing experiences. I leverage design principles to effectively communicate, convey meaning, and guide desired behaviors.

2022-2023
2019-2022

2007-2010
1996-2006
From March 2022 to June 2023, I served as Principal User Experience Designer at Coupa Software, Inc., a company specializing in business procurement and spend management software as a service. At Coupa, many of my past experiences came together to create a more holistic design process.
I was the Lead User Experience Designer at CloudCheckr from September 2019 to March 2022. CloudCheckr, which was acquired by NetApp in October 2021, is a cloud operations (CloudOps & FinOps) platform. At CloudCheckr, I used my skills in designing for scale and impact.
At EagleView, a company focused on aerial imagery, data analytics, and GIS mapping, I held the position of Senior User Experience Designer from July 2018 to September 2019. At EagleView, I utilized artifical intelligence and machine learning in simplifying work processes and improving productivity.
I worked as a User Experience Design Consultant for Kodak Alaris, a digital imaging software and hardware company spun off from Eastman Kodak, from March 2015 to October 2017. At Kodak Alaris, I simplified onboarding by documenting and questioning the current process.
From May 2011 to February 2015, I was the Principal User Experience Designer at Dell/KACE (now Quest KACE), an endpoint management and system deployment company. Quest Software acquired KACE in 2016. At Dell, I began to design for scale, allowing actions to find be taken on multiple devices at once.
I held the position of Senior User Experience Designer at Eastman Kodak, a digital imaging and photographic products company, from October 2007 to September 2010. At Kodak, I developed a design process to simplify complex administrative tasks.
My career in user experience design began at Xerox, a document technology and productivity company, where I worked as a Senior User Experience Designer from July 1996 to December 2006. Here I learned competitive benchmarking and research skills.
